summary:
Dr. Buluma is an accomplished Senior Technical Advisor in the fields of: Governance, Anti-Corruption, Democracy, Rule of Law and Sexual and Gender Based Violence with an outstanding record of research, design, management, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of bilateral and multilateral development programs in these five thematic focus areas. He is experienced in leading sector-wide as well as discrete interventions utilizing a broad array of organizational development interventions: from undertaking institutional and political economy analyses and facilitating stakeholder workshops to inform policy formulation and structural reforms, to refining monitoring and evaluation systems to improve performance and results. He is also well versed in budget oversight for large portfolios with his largest one standing at 2.8 Million euros.

Dr. Buluma possesses sixteen years of progressive experience in the facilitation of agreements with both government and civil society actors to cooperate on interventions related to Governance, Anti-Corruption, Democracy, Rule of Law and Sexual and Gender Based Violence at the national, regional, and international levels in accordance with the principles of good governance, integrity, transparency, and accountability. He also has proven success advising government officials and civil society on citizen engagement and participation with a focus on transparency and accountability, with the overall objective of engaging citizens to advocate for reform, monitor government performance, and hold public agencies accountable.

Additionally, Dr. Buluma holds a PhD in Comparative Constitutional Law from the University of Nairobi, School of Law, and has extensive practical knowledge and experience working, researching, publishing, and teaching on Governance, Anti-corruption, Democracy, Rule of Law and Sexual and Gender Based Violence. He combines rigorous academic research with a commitment to innovation for real world impact. His research areas of interest include constitutional law, separation of powers, rule of law, good governance, democracy, corruption and economic crimes, law and politics, gender and equality, sexual and gender-based violence, women and children’s rights, sexual and reproductive health rights, and judicial reform.
